HelpTextPassingSecret1: You can Scout monsters and battle with others when you use Tag Mode! It doesn't matter if you're in the field or have the DS closed, you can still use Tag Mode! Check to see if there are other players out there using "StreetPass Player"!
HelpTextPassingSecret2: If you are able to continuously win StreetPass battles, you'll be rewarded with a special battle! You may even encounter an opponent here that's exclusive to these events! Do your best to get 10 wins, and see what happens!
HelpTextPassingSecret4: You can use Tag Mode even while you have accessories equipped! Accessories equiped by Monsters used in tag mode cannot be removed until the Monster returns. Make sure you choose which accessories to use carefully!
HelpTextPassingSecret5: There's an old saying in the world about StreetPass Battles. "The most legendary of masters will fight against all they pass, and defeat the strongest of foes." I've never confirmed this for myself. However, it might be best for you to see it with your own eyes. Perhaps if you participate in enough StreetPass battles, you too will encounter this legendary Master... or become one yourself! I hope you can defeat them, though!
HelpTextPassingSecret6: Using Tag mode, you may be able to encounter rare event-only monsters! If you save an encounter with such to your battle memories, you will also be able to distribute them to other players. Spread the love! Be sure to check the DQMJ3 Professional official website for more information regarding events.

MenuMessageTournamentFirst00: Welcome to the Survival Battle Mode. Let's quickly go over a few things quickly regarding how it works.
MenuMessageTournamentFirst01: In this mode, enemy teams continue to come at you one after another.
MenuMessageTournamentFirst02: As the rounds progress, your opponents will continue to get stronger until you are eventually defeated.
MenuMessageTournamentFirst03: You can freely swap monsters and give orders, but you cannot use items or scout monsters.
MenuMessageTournamentFirst04: If you lose in here, you won't lose any of your hard earned gold, so don't be worried about that, either.
MenuMessageTournamentFirst05: For every 10 consecutive wins you achieve, you will be given a reward as well.
MenuMessageTournamentFirst07: Your battle records are also being monitored. So try to make every match count in there.
MenuMessageTournamentFirst08: First, start off by aiming to win 50 in a row. Now, then... let's get this Survival Battle started!

MenuMessageTournamentWin10_49_1: However, you'll need to do better than that to reach the top. Just keep training, and try again.

MenuMessageCourseInfo1_2: Plain Course with few obstacles At the same time, increased visibility for you should make it all around easier to obtain and protect your gathered slimes.
MenuMessageCourseInfo2_1: Wilderness Course with many floors Players position's start out seperated by many steps. Use the steps to protect yourself and trap your opponents.
MenuMessageCourseInfo2_2: Wilderness Course with many floors You can also use these steps to reach a higher vantage point, plan your next move, and launch attacks on your opponents with ease.
MenuMessageCourseInfo3_2: A course, with a big walled-off structure, stood up right in the center of all of the action. There are 4 openings that lead into this "fortress" of sorts. Each of these doorways can and should be utilized, to setup assaults and ambushes against your opponents. Use the terrain to your advantage!
MenuMessageCourseInfo4_1: A two entrance cave course. You must pass through the cave entrances to get to slime spots easily facing your foe. A high-difficulty map.
MenuMessageCourseInfo4_2: A two entrance cave course. Various camps are placed in the corners. Steal the slimes at the entrances from your foe.

MenuMessageRaceAttackDesc02: Charge【SHOT】 The longer you hold the button, the further the shot will travel. Knocks back opponents as well. Causes ALL Slimes to be dropped upon contact.
MenuMessageRaceAttackDesc03: ﾚFire【SHOT】 【For Beginners】 A short-range projectile. Causes 1 slime to be dropped upon contact.
MenuMessageRaceAttackDesc04: Shotgun【SHOT】 A short-ranged blast that sprays out in all directions like a shotgun blast. Causes 1 slime to be dropped upon contact.
MenuMessageRaceAttackDesc05: Boomerang【SHOT】 A short-range, slow blast that returns to its owner. Its path of travel can be manipulated by movement.  Causes 1 slime to be dropped upon contact.
MenuMessageRaceAttackDesc07: Tackle【SHORT】 Quickly hits an opponent very hard. Can also be used to move around. When it hits an enemy, it causes them to drop all their slimes.
MenuMessageRaceAttackDesc08: Magnetic Hit【SHOT】 3 light orbs that track down their targets. They can even block incoming attacks. Causes ALL slimes to drop upon contact.
MenuMessageRaceAttackDesc09: Shock Stomp【SHORT】 Jump and cause a shockwave upon landing. Knocks all surrounding opponents back. Causes ALL slimes to drop upon contact.
MenuMessageRaceAttackDesc10: Spin Attack【SHORT】 Move around while spinning to generate shock waves and smash into surrounding opponents. Causes ALL slimes to drop upon contact.
MenuMessageRaceAttackDesc11: ﾚTornado【ATK】 【For Beginners】 Blow away surrounding enemies with a tornado. Causes ALL slimes to drop upon contact.
MenuMessageRaceAttackDesc12: 【ATK】Fuddle Bomb When placed, it will remain there for a limited period of time. Enemies hit will have reversed controls, and drop a Slime.
MenuMessageRaceAttackDesc13: Fire Bomb【ATK】 It will stay for a moment, where it is placed. It will slowly pull in it's surroundings and blow them up. Hits cause all slimes to be dropped.

MenuMessageRaceAttackDesc14: Grav Bomb【ATK】 Stays in place for a limited time period. Pulls in opponents and slows them down upon contact. Causes ALL slimes to drop upon contact.
MenuMessageRaceAttackDesc15: Boost Ball【ATK】 Stays in place for a limited time period. Launches whoever touches it into others. Causes ALL slimes to drop upon contact.
